channel.title: MooseScape Beta 20%
channel.description:
Well i am 20% into the beta of my latest project MooseScape, I have been working alone on this but i used a source made by Wolf on rune-server.org.
Current Credits - 60% Wolf, 40% me Hoping to redo it completely so get at least 80% of Creds :]
Current Accomplishments. - Fixed Whip and D scimmy spec no longer D/C's when equiped - 100% me - Fixed eating timer (originally took about 4 secs to eat and wouldnt eat in combat) now fully works - 100% Owns (forgot other part :S) - Fixed magic xp alching is no longer instant lvling but does give money - 50% me 50% wolf. - Added full edgy monastery and fixed wildy, added all the monks and everything. - Fixed the bows in wild no longer rapid hits, still havent fixed in duel arena :S - Removed a lot of the specs because they would lagg out and glitch up just doing emote not hitting - 70% me 30% My friend brian :] - Added ::home command to take you back to the monastary. - Monastery based (original idea of mine) 100% me. - Fixed about 60% of the glitched npcs like delrith, Removed over half of all D/C'ing npcs and re-replace most in correct Co-ords - 80% me - Solution to jad cave lagging out you can now you ::jad - Removed all commands using ::barrows ::lett etc, gives toolkit :P - 100% me - Umm sort of fixed the alching so it goes back to mage book (only works for superheat atm) - Full based npc training - 70% wolf for system 30% me for a lot of npcs :] - Removed over 50% of bankers to reduce lagg - Removed a few non working doors that disconnect - Thanks to i_own__u for making me webclient (under construction) - 100% i own u - Fixed the 1hp glitch on a few npcs such as the tzok's - Evened out the damage between Att/def & aggresive. - More to come!
My goals in 30% (beta V0.3) - Money from wcing (credz to whoever is helping :]) - Make alchs go back to mage book - Fix all 1hp glitches in npcs - Add npcs to every city - Fix food autotimer - Remove all shops and replace with my own custom - Remove summoning and replace with a few mobile shops in the music tab - Fix a few item glitches like new crystal bow and mud staff (so they dont hit uber fast) - Get more coders/testers :]
Want to join the team? Register here http://z7.invisionfree.com/moosevill3/index.php?act=idx
Note that this is here for development purposes and it is under the Development/Help section so please don't flame. Don't say that this is advertising because i am not giving out the hamachi networks nor the custom port.
I would also like to give 5% of my credits to Simonkills1 for testing my server and helping me find glitches. And another 5% to Iron Skillz for being an awesome coder :]
Just 2 pics my comp is being weird :S (err 1 snagit crashed on me :[)
[IMG]http://i173.photobucket.com/albums/w66/Inflacoarch/mona.gif[/img]
[br][size=1]Posted on: June 27, 2007, 06:22:12 PM[/size][hr]Pic up :]

item.title: MooseScape Beta 20%
item.dc:creator: @wicked_pker wicked pker
item.description:
@wicked_pker wrote:

case 1276: // tree if(playerLevel[8] >= 1) { // Tom startAnimation(875); sendMessage("you get a log of the tree , Wow !"); addSkillXP((30*playerLevel[8]), 8); addItem(995, 10000); actionTimer = 5; } else { sendMessage("you need 0 wc to cut this!"); }
add this well edit cases etc

u said u wanna no how trees give money add this il post another soon so u need axe[br][size=1]Posted on: June 28, 2007, 05:41:17 AM[/size][hr][code]public boolean WC() {

if(WCTimer <= 0) {
if(TreeHP == 0) {
AddGlobalObj(TreeX, TreeY, 1341, 0, 10);
sendMessage(“This tree has ran out of logs”);
ResetWC();
return false;
}
else {
if(!hasAxe()) {
sendMessage(“You need an axe to chop down this tree.”);
ResetWC();
}
else if(hasAxe()) {
addSkillXP(WCxp, 8);
if(!addItem(logID, logAmount)) {
ResetWC();
return false;
}
else {
sendMessage(“You get some logs.”);
WCTimer = TreeTimer;
TreeHP–;
return true;
}
}
}
}
return false;
}[/code]

edit this for axe needed

item.title: MooseScape Beta 20%
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

"Owned" or "Pwned" is an internet slang word used commonly in gaming circles. The term originated among 1990s hackers, where it referred to "rooting" or gaining administrative control over someone else's computer.[1][2] By 1997 it was regularly used in website defacements.[3][4] It then spread to gaming circles, where it came to mean acquisition of superiority through the downfall of another entity, be it another gaming clan, or a single user. This can be in the context of winning an online game, a debate on a forum, or attaining a successful hacking, as well as the signature to a rebuttal, such as "You got owned!" to announce the defeat of another user on the internet in the form of a debate or flame war. It signifies screwing up, being humiliated or beaten, often through the dominance or superiority of another party expressing an overpowering sense of skill or an artful use of style in procuring victory. Usually, the term is used to express dominance in a negative sense, proclaiming better skill than the opponent for purposes of killing them. "Owned" can be used as a verb (to "own"), an adverb ("owningly") and a noun ("ownage"). Some may even type 0wned, or 0wn3d as it is commonly used in leet speak.

owned …

Read full topic
